repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Norman H. Finkelstein is a Massachusetts-based writer of nonfiction for children and adults.The collection contains correspondence, manuscripts, galleys, proofs and further editorial material pertaining to the author's career and his 16 published and 19 unpublished works.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Norman H. Finkelstein is a Massachusetts-based writer of nonfiction for children and adults. He is the recipient of the Golden Kite Honor Book Award for Nonfiction, for With Heroic Truth: The Life of Edward R. Murrow, and two National Jewish Book Awards, for Forged in Freedom: Shaping the Jewish American Experience and Heeding the Call:Jewish Voices in America's Civil Rights Struggle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, manuscripts, galleys, proofs and further editorial material pertaining to the author's career and both his published and unpublished works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Published and Unpublished Works ( undated, 1983-2007)
Series II: Correspondence, Presentations, Awards, and Media ( undated, 1984-2005)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Norman H. Finkelstein Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to children's literature and associated artwork. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.
